hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{1}{3}}$.

![rectangle with 1 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/06d30561e7af631ebdede28123a20e87ffcc5a15)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{3}} \neq \greenD{\dfrac{6}{8}}$

![rectangle with 1 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 sixth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7b966a973cf852de08addfdc50498afccd98063e)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{3}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{6}}$

![rectangle with 1 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 2 of 6 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 sixth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fb4f6697e24ee02b8e56611a80e06914bf038567)

$\blueD{\dfrac{1}{3}} = \purpleD{\dfrac{2}{6}}$

The following fraction is equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac13}$:

- $\purpleD{\dfrac{2}{6}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac13$?**
